qas.question: How many new releases were offered for the Super Famicom Jr.?

context: In <a4_0><b8_0>October 1997<b8_0/><a4_0/>, Nintendo released a redesigned model of the SNES (the SNS-101 model) in North America for <a0_0>US<b5_0>$99<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which sometimes included the pack-in game <a1_0><b7_0>Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island<b7_0/><a1_0/>. Like the earlier redesign of the NES (the NES-101 model), the new model was slimmer and lighter than its predecessor, but it lacked <a2_0><b6_0>S-Video and RGB output<b6_0/><a2_0/>, and <b9_0>it was among the last major SNES-related releases in the region<b9_0/>. A similarly redesigned <a3_0>Super Famicom Jr.<a3_0/> was released in Japan at around the same time.
